Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,276Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 3

entry.title: Again
entry.summary:
Author: Igni_hendricks

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,464Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 300

Summary: When Merlin kills Morgana, she thinks it’s finally over. But then she wakes up several years in the past, in the heart of Camelot, surrounded by the very people she wants dead.She needs a plan, and she needs answers. Neither of these things turn out to be as simple as they seem, and Morgana begins to wonder if there could have been a different path for her after all.

entry.title: Merlin (How the Series Should Have Gone - With Sugar and Spice and Everything Nice)
entry.summary:
Author: Nobody_Important69

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,400Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: I am determined to make at least one good Merthur fic in my lifetime. I write plenty for fun, but I want to do a serious one as well. I am going to rewrite the Merlin series one episode at a time, only how it should have gone (with a hopefully happy ending) and plenty (and I mean plenty) of up close and personal encounters with the two. This is hopefully going to be a rollercoaster of emotions and be mostly series accurate with various bits of actual dialogue. I recommend watching each episode first as it will focus on the parts we want to see/really important parts, rather than the full plot though it will be used a lot (so you may want to be lore updated). Other than that, be prepared for explicit because I'm going all in. I also will try to make it funny.

entry.title: The Price of Magic
entry.summary:
Author: Belle_Lestrange101

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,398Chapters: 17/35Kudos: 129

Summary: Unsatisfied with his current life, Merlin takes a sabbatical from work and explores the British coastline to clear his head of life's mundaneness. On his return from Cornwall, he comes across a young blonde girl attempting to hitch-hike along the motorway. Fearing for her safety, Merlin offers her a ride home.Upon entering the small town of Cam-Lott, Merlin makes a lasting impression on Police Chief Arthur Pendranyl and starts a chain of events that have him seeing the inside of a jail cell more often than not. When he isn't being an errand-boy or stumbling upon strange trinkets in forest caves, Merlin slots into the small town life with ease. Between summer faire's, camping trips and hiking, Merlin almost forgets that no one in the town -except one -has left the towns perimeter.Why has no one left? Why are his memories feeling hazier by the day? And why, oh why, is there a sword buried in a stone?[Rating will change in later chapters]

entry.title: To Suffer and Change It All
entry.summary:
Author: Kateis_Cakeis

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 123,961Chapters: 18/19Kudos: 385

Summary: What if… instead of summoning the Fomorroh, Morgana kept Merlin prisoner? Just so that he could finally answer all her questions. At knifepoint. Until Merlin admits a truth he should have kept to himself…In doing so, Morgana planned to show Arthur all that he was, except… what if he didn’t experience the disgust she expected? entry.title: The Heart of the Kingdom
entry.summary:
Author: juliairian

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 61,891Chapters: 12/37Kudos: 63

Summary: "Camelot had to be different to suddenly accommodate such a person as Merlin. He could never have existed in Camelot before, and therefore, Camelot changed. There had to be shadows and secrets to keep Merlin safe, mysteries to bring them together, and silences for all the words they never said to each other."Merlin saves one man from Uther's pyre and never becomes Arthur's servant - instead, the two unlikely friends must defend Camelot and over time learn the truth about magic and what happened before the Purge. Will magic in Camelot gain two powerful protectors despite the world trying to keep them apart?

entry.title: When love blossoms
entry.summary:
Author: Trialbyname

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 77,455Chapters: 48/51Kudos: 326

Summary: "I command you again," Sir Leon let out, "Show yourselves!"Arthur rose first, his movements slow and careful. Merlin, after having gotten over the initial surprise, mirrored Arthurs movements, rising from his spot with both hands over his head. And he got to take in the ever so glorious sight of the four knights, looking between the two of them in pure confusion."I am truly sorry if we were a bother to you, sir knight." Arthur let out, a small tone of mockery in his voice."How-how is this...?" Gwaine let out, "How is this possible?"---Once upon a time, a choice was made. A choice that would have held consequences for the kingdom of Camelot, and everyone who lived there, had it gone through. But it didn't.But now, Merlin and Arthur find themselves in an alternate universe where it did.

entry.title: the true physics of all things pathetic
entry.summary:
Author: deniigiq

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,154Chapters: 7/8Kudos: 106

Summary: “I know it sounds ridiculous,” Arthur says. “But I can’t stop thinking about him, Guinevere. It’s like I can feel him. His heart right here.”He lays his palm over his chest and holds it there. On an impulse, Gwen joins him. Arthur lets his hand fall so that hers can spread out over the thin layer of linen over his skin, and that’s when she feels it.Arthur’s heart beats in the usual rhythm, but there is a flutter there, too.No, not just a flutter, a full beat between the others and behind it.Arthur lifts his face to hers, and Gwen has never been more thankful that he cannot see the horror spreading rapidly across her own. (To prevent Arthur's death at the Battle of Camlann, Merlin makes a magical exchange - he gives Arthur his heart in exchange for Arthur's sight. Arthur makes it home, but Merlin doesn't, so Gwen sets out to find him and bring him home, only to discover that Merlin isn't exactly the person she thought him to be.)

Summary: They were going on a hunting trip, like they’ve done so many times before and of course Merlin had a funny feeling again. Only this time, not everyone could be saved.
